snippet: Refusing to appear on the State House floor, Democrats prevented the start of a scheduled lawmaking session for a second day in a row on Thursday.
abstract: Indiana Democrats prevent the start of a scheduled lawmaking session for a second day by refusing to appear on the State House floor, as pressure over 'right to work' legislation mounts; Republicans say a law prohibiting union contracts at private-sector workplaces from requiring workers to pay union dues or other fees would attract businesses to the state, while Democrats say the measure would weaken unions and harm benefits for workers.
lead_paragraph: Refusing to appear on the State House floor, Democrats prevented the start of a scheduled lawmaking session for a second day in a row on Thursday.

headline.main: Indiana: Absent Democrats Hold Up House Session
headline.print_headline: Indiana: Absent Democrats Hold Up House Session
